text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so a while back i 
shared with you a recipe from my favorite granola

and many of you have made it and have reported 
back happily so i'm super happy to hear about that

but today i've got one more for you and this 
is new and this has become our new favorite one

in my family and this one is thai inspired 
yes so the idea of this came from a thai

snack called grayasat which is basically our 
version of a chewy sticky granola bar except

instead of oats we use puffed rice so i thought 
what if i use the flavor of kriyasan and apply

it to the western granola using oatmeal how 
would that work i tried it out and it worked

out so well and i thought i have to share this 
with you guys it's so good all right let's get

started first let's make the syrup for our oats 
so i've got here some thai palm sugar that i've

chopped but you can also just use light brown 
sugar if you want but the palm sugar if you

have it really adds a nice thai flavor to this 
granola and that's going into our pot right here

and now a little bit of coconut milk and 
instead of using regular neutral flavored

oil that i normally use in my granola i'm going 
to add virgin coconut oil and you want to use

virgin coconut oil not refined coconut oil because 
refined coconut oil has no flavor in it so that's

good for cooking when you don't want the coconut 
flavor but now we definitely do and a little bit

of salt to balance out all that sweetness 
and i'm just gonna bring this to a simmer

and i'm gonna cook this just until 
the sugar is completely dissolved

okay so it really does not need to be boiling 
like this but this stove is so strong it doesn't

do low heat very well but it's okay that it does 
it's just hard when it's foaming so much to see

whether the sugar has been dissolved so i just 
want to keep checking that there's no more

lumps of sugar yeah i think we're good there 
all right i'm going to turn that off that smell

ah reminds me of thai grilled bananas and they 
basically grill thai bananas and then pour a

syrup of palm sugar and coconut over it's one 
of my favorite things and this just smells so

much like that very nice oh so that is our syrup 
how simple is that now key ingredient in this

recipe sesame seeds i'm going to add both black 
and white sesame seeds you can just add one but

if you only add white you won't really be able to 
see them at the end because they'll just kind of

blend in with everything else so i like a little 
bit of black make sure you toast these first so

that they are aromatic just in a dry saute pan 
until they start to pop and smoke a little bit and

become really aromatic you can tell it'll smell 
really good now if i throw the sesame into the

cooked granola what's going to happen is they're 
not going to stick they're going to just like fall

to the bottom of the bag right so you don't want 
to do that what you want to do is add them to the

syrup and the syrup will help the sesame seeds 
stick to the oats at the end and you want to

do this to any small thing that you want to add 
to granola granola is very flexible you can add

chia seeds whatever little seeds you want right 
but if they're really small you want to put them

in the syrup all right so that's it now let's get 
the oats so i've got some regular rolled oats here

but quick oats if that's what you already have 
for your oatmeal that'll work as well quick oats

will actually be a little bit more crisp and 
delicate where these will have a firmer crunch

so whatever you want now pour the syrup all over 
the oats oh yes so good now you want to quickly

mix that in you don't want the syrup to cool 
down otherwise they'll have a hard time sort of

being distributed at this point you might 
be tempted to add cinnamon add vanilla and

whatever spices you want but i'm telling you if 
you want to experience the pure flavor of kriyasat

don't add anything don't add cinnamon don't add 
anything just the flavor of palm sugar and coconut

and sesame is what you want to shine in this 
okay oh that looks so good that looks so good

you want to spread it out onto a baking sheet 
that's been lined with either silicone pad or

parchment paper and you want to get 
it as evenly spread out as possible

and i like to actually make a hole in the 
middle just for more even baking because i find

that it'll bake evenly around the edge and there's 
always a patch in the middle that's not quite as

cooked so if i just don't put anything there 
then i don't have to deal with that problem

so this is going to go into a 325 degree oven for 
about 30 to 35 minutes and you want to stir it

halfway through to make sure everything is evenly 
distributed so it's only been halfway through so

it does not look like much has happened but you 
want to give them a stir and redistribute anyway

to make sure you have an even even cooking 
so i just bring the outside in to a pile

and then sort of like redistribute from 
there and you want these as thinly spread

out as possible so they cook faster all right 
back into the oven for another 15 minutes or

really at this point however long it's gonna take 
until these become a little bit darker and crispy

so while the granola is baking i wanna talk you 
through our add-ins so when it comes to granola

you can add whatever dried fruits or nuts you 
want but if you want the thai flavor a couple

things that you want to have first and i would say 
the most important is toasted coconut so i've got

these flakes right here which i like the look 
of also moska yasad uses this shape of coconuts

so it's a little bit more reminiscent but you can 
also just use the shredded finely shredded coconut

but if you use those again you want to add it to 
the syrup with the sesame seeds otherwise they're

not going to stick will just fall out to the 
bottom and i just toasted this in a dry saute pan

until they're nice and dark none of that's blonde 
golden coconut okay golden coconut has no flavor

you want dark brown toasted like this okay now 
for a true grayasat flavor you also want to have

some peanuts i've got here some roasted peanuts 
i leave them in the skins because just you know

nice pops of color that way but they definitely 
don't have to be in the skin again i roasted these

in the oven just for about 20 minutes at 350. if 
you're allergic to peanuts cashews will work as

well cashew is the other thai nut i suppose and 
in addition to that i'm also going to throw in

some pumpkin seeds because i like the green that 
pumpkin seeds add to granola so that's just an

aesthetic thing you don't have to add it now 
when it comes to dried fruit i want to add a thai

dried fruit that i just recently got a hold of and 
that is dried longans yes so these are thai dried

longans and lankans are the sweet juicy super 
fragrant fruit and the dried version is to me just

as delicious as the fresh one you can actually 
buy the chinese dried lankans at most big asian

supermarkets you want to choose ones that are 
dried out of the shell because you can also buy

whole dried lungs that's not what we want and you 
want to pick ones that are lighter in color more

golden those are fresher as they become older and 
over they do get darker a little bit so just go

for the lighter ones if you want to buy thai dried 
longans you can get them on amazon if you're in

the us so i'll put a link to that maybe if i can 
find it and then i'm also going to add some tart

cranberries just because the these are not thai 
obviously but because the lankans are super sweet

a little bit tartness is a nice contrast look at 
this the color has darkened and you want to make

sure that it's crispy so if i take the end here 
you can obviously see this is crispy right but

when it first comes out of the oven it's not going 
to be crispy because it's hot so you can only

check for crispness after it's cooled down so if 
you're not sure you can always take a little bit

and blow on it really quickly to check if it's 
crispy or not but i find that if the color has

darkened significantly visibly chances are 
it's already crispy look ah so good so good
so good not too sweet it has that iconic

three assad flavor and it's even going to taste 
more like a yasad once we add our coconut okay

so this has cooled i'm just gonna add it 
all to my mixing bowl what you want some

adam cannot wait i'm just gonna take all 
of this stuck together now don't worry
we'll break it up in the bowl

yes listen to the sound of crispiness now this 
is enough i mean you can just put this in a

container and just snack on it but to make it 
complete we've got to add all our other stuff

we just want to break the big chunks down 
a little bit it's a little more manageable

in goes our coconut the most 
important thing some peanuts
and some cashews why not it looks like a bit much

pumpkin seeds and of course the 
star of the show some dried longans

and when it comes to granola you can add as much 
or as little of the fruits and nuts as you want

it's completely up to you it doesn't affect the 
recipe at all there we go give it a nice toss
a bigger bowl would be nice

how pretty is this so now i want to do a 
final taste with all the little components

i want to make sure i get some peanuts 
in there some definitely some coconut
in there i got a long end maybe a
cranberry

it's a little bit it's kind of surreal actually 
like because you know in my head i'm eating it and

as the flavors come like oh my god this tastes 
exactly like assad but at the same time it's

different you know like same same but different 
because it's oatmeal and there's other stuff in

it but it's so good it's such a unique flavor 
the coconut the palm sugar and it's a simple

combination that really produces a unique tasting 
granola this will go great on yogurt you can eat

it on its own you can top ice cream with it you 
can put it on top of muffins and then bake i mean

there's so many different uses for granola most of 
the time i eat it with yogurt or just on its own

just like that and that is it i hope you give this 
a try and i hope you really enjoy it let me know

what you think once you've made it and the recipe 
as always will be on hotthaikitchen.com and if

you haven't subscribed to the show make sure you 
do so you don't miss a recipe and click the bell

icon as well so you get a notification when i post 
a new video thank you as always for watching and

i will see you next time for your next delicious 
thai meal did you see that fell out of my mouth
